page.title: 10Keadby Power Station
page.content: -Along Chapel Lane,Keadby. There is rail access to the stores.The 3 chimneys are 97m high and weigh 4420 tonnes.The internal diameter being 5.7 m.The station was gradually run down and officially closed in October 1984, because the Drax station had 11 times larger output capacity,and many of the machinery parts were obsolete.When the plant was closed the workforce were given 3 options-early retirement, voluntary severance pay or alternative employment within the industry.At the moment contractors are taking out the machinery most of which is being sold for scrap.The precious metals e.g. copper and brass are being removed and sold.Then the asbestos will be removed under controlled conditions so none gets into the atmosphere.The brickwork demolition will not be for another two years.
